page.title: 16Wool Post Office
page.content: 1.Customers in a day: For 9 months of the year we serve 500 customers daily, rising to 800 during July and August. 2. What we do at the Post Office: We serve 600 pensions per week; 300 child benefits; 50 sickness and unemployment benefits. We sell stamps to send letters and parcels all over the world. There are 23 different stamps varying from 1p to Â£5.00. 3. Mail Sorting: Letters and packets are sent to us from Wareham each morning at 5.30 a.m. The postmen sort the letters into the different streets and roads and deliver them to each house on bicycle 4. In the sorting office we have 2 postmen.
